  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 3 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAPS ON THE INNER 5 LITER PLASTIC CONTAINERS WERE LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND 2 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED FROM ONE OF THEM ONTO THE OUTER CARTON WHICH WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS LEAKED ONTO BY ANOTHER PACKAGE. WHEN PACKAGE WAS OPENED TO SEE WHETHER THE CONTENTS WERE SALVAGEABLE FOR A REWRAP OR IF THEY HAD BEEN DAMAGED THE BAG OF ALGAECIDE WAS SEEN. IT HAD AN OXIDIZER DIAMOND AND THE UN NUMBER UN3378 PRINTED ONTO THE BAG ALONG WITH OTHER DANGER MARKINGS. INSIDE THE BOX WERE SMALL WHITE GRANULES THAT HAD COME OUT OF THE BAG. THEY DID NOT EVERY LEAK ANYWHERE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGING, BUT THE BAG IS DAMAGED.

item.title: Report X-2024041234
item.description:
Report X-2024041234

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND PRODUCING A PUDDLE FROM SPILLAGE BY THE SWEEPER IN UNLOAD-C AT DOOR 27. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND A 2' PUDDLE OF LIQUID NEUTRALIZED CLEANED UP, THEN ALL AFFECTED MATERIALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THERE WAS A CRACK ON THE SIDE OF 1 OF 4 POLY, 1-GAL JUGS. THE INNER PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF A CORRUGATED DIVIDER AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOPX RATED AT A 350 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

  • Description: Fully regulated hazmat containing a plastic gallon of chlorine oxidizer. The box was wet and had strong fumes coming out from the gallon having a large crack on the body and spilling all of liquid. We mistakenly added foam neutralizer to try and contain the spill, but the chemicals reacted that caused box to get hot. Immediately showered it with water to contain it from getting worse and eventually cooled it down. Placed it inside a plastic drum as soon as it was good enough to touch, sealed it with double bag and zip ties. Did not want to open again to re examine for safety concerns.

item.title: Report X-2024041240
item.description:
Report X-2024041240

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THERE WAS A FOUND PACKAGE WHERE THE CONTENTS APPEARED TO BE DAMAGED. THE UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED FOR A RESPONDER AND MADE HIS WAY BACK TO THE PRIMARY UNLOAD TO RESPOND TO THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN TRAILER. DONNED PROPER PPE, FOLLOW THE DECISION TREE, AND REMOVED THE PACKAGE FROM THE TRAILER TO OUR DMP AREA. RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO CALL THE FT RMP FOR THE SORT, TO LET HIM KNOW ABOUT THE UNKOWN LEAKER. AFTER THE SORT, WHEN ENTERING THE PACKAGE INTO ETT AS A DAMAGE, WE OPENED IT TO FIND A DAMAGED/LEAKING BATTERY. UPON LOOKING UP THE SDS, IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN REGULATED AND SCBA DONNED. THIS IS WHEN FT RMP CALLED THE UPS HAZMAT HELP DESK, AND WE ENTERED AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT INTO ETT. AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER HAD TO BE CALLED TO RESPOND TO THIS PACKAGE SINCE RESPONDER DID NOT HAVE PROPER PPE TO DMP THE PACKAGE.

item.title: Report I-2024030012
item.description:
Report I-2024030012

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T00:33:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: WARRIOR
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LCT TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 76775
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: We transport UN 3170 Aluminum remelting by product in end dump trailers. Our driver was traveling north on 1-65 in Alabama. There had been snow and ice earlier that week. The driver came upon a multi vehicle accident. The driver attempted to slow and stop, but the vehicle got onto black ice and was unable to stop. This resulted in a collision that caused our trailer to partially over turn spilling some of the product. The divider wall prevented our trailer from completely turning over. Emergency response personal was notified, and clean up began. Alabama State Troopers have not produced an accident report as of 2/15/2024.

item.title: Report E-2024040610
item.description:
Report E-2024040610

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1993 Glycol Ether EB release from a 330-gallon poly tote while at the customer location. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred into a new poly tote and then provided to the customer. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbent pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum along with all spent absorbent pads. The waste removed from site pending disposal.

UPON INSTECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (4) 1.5 OUNCE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF ARMOR ALL FRESH FX RAPID ODOR ELIMINATOR. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM FLORIDA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 82V99Y, AMAZON.COM.KYDC, INC., 1760 COUNTY LINE RD, LAKELAND FL 33811-1808.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XBO experienced a UN2810 XL-Dri release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of product released to the metal drum lid only due to a loose bung cap. The cap was tightened and secured for shipment on. The released product was collected with absorbents. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNA experienced a UN3266 Pro-Yellow Plus Super Duty Coil Cleaner release from 2 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-ounces of product released to the cardboard packaging and pallet only due to a pallet puncture. The impacted cardboard and pallet wood were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All (8) 1-gallon poly jugs of product were containerized into a separate 55-gallon poly drum along with the spent absorbents. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

The liquid impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with Oil Dri and place the contents into a 10 gallon metal drum which was then left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • City: ALBUQUERQUE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Daniel Vallejos Operations Supervisor called to report a spill in trailer 84985 of a UN2880, CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE,HYDRATED, 5.1, PG II,. Daniel stated when the crew open the roll up door to unload the trailer. Daniel stated two pallets had fell over and started to come out the bottom of the roll up door while opening. Daniel stated 1 pail of the product the top lid came off and spilled what looked to be tablets on the trailer floor. Daniel stated he had already recouped the pallets and put the product (tablets) back in the pail and secured the lid to the pail. Safety advised Daniel any time th ere is a Hazmat spill safety is to be notified immediately before any cleanup is to start. Daniel stated that he would call safety next time before cleaning any spill. Daniel stated the spill was cleaned and the pallets were recouped and already unloaded off the trailer.

  • Description: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. Upon examination, it was discovered that the content had a loose cap, leading to a leakage that spread across the other bottles.

item.title: Report E-2024040612
item.description:
Report E-2024040612

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XBO experienced a UN3260 “Caroat” release from (3) 55-pound plastic bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged bags and all released material were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All remaining bags were restacked and secured for shipment on. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: MERIDIAN
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 16 ounces of MasterSeal TC 299FS (UN1866) released from (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to the lid being pinched (unsure what caused it since it was protected by dunnage). The release impacted the trailer floor and dock floor. The SDS was reviewed with the caller and it was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 10-gallon DM, Contains (1) metal pail, product, spent oil dri, shrinkwrap, and PPE was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/2/2024, at 1624 hours, FRA Hazardous Materials Inspector L. Rawls, at the CSXT Gentilly Yard in New Orleans, LA discovered UTLX 130322, a residue tank car last contained: Zinc Chloride, with the fill port cover open. The car was isolated and the shipper, Micronutrients, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-04-02--00252). Specialized Professional Services, Inc. (SPSI), a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to assess and correct the reported issue. SPSI personnel inspected, closed and secured the fill port cover. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Keith Hughes at 317-494-0256). While no visible product release was noted, because this shipment was found open to the atmosphere, and per FRA guidance, it is presumed that some volume of hazardous material vapor or residue was released.

  • Description: The hose connection was leaking when the driver started his unload. When they hook up they are to do a twist test on the hose to make sure it doesn't spin at all. Any movement indicates either the gasket is bad or the camlocks that lock it down may need to be shimmed. It did not twist when he tried moving it and the gaskets all looked good. After he applied shims though it did stop the leak. We're taking this hose out of use going forward and getting it back to the manufacturer so they can inspect it and replace the fitting on the end. 8 ounces hit the ground beyond the spill bucket.

item.title: Report I-2024040027
item.description:
Report I-2024040027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: BRASELTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TEAM LOGISTICS COMPANY LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 140000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Team Logistics Driver Eric Bell (Owner Operator 1099 Contractor) was making a bulk delivery of gasoline to Race Trac #232 on 1450 McEver Road, Gainesville, GA 30501. The delivery's inception; TransMontaigne Terminal on 3450 Jefferson Road, Athens, GA 30607 loading of Metroplex Energy. In route to the delivery on Highway 53 @ Hoyt Holder Road heading North, in Braselton, GA. Mr. Bell failed to maintain his lane of travel and rolled his tractor trailer. Mr. Bell stated, there were three vehicles in front of him traveling approximately 25 mph, and another vehicle turning right (South) from Hoyt Holder Road causing him to move toward the right shoulder. This movement brought Mr. Bells tires off the road and onto the soft, muddy shoulder. As Mr. Bell brought his tractor back onto the roadway the trailer entered a drop off area that turned the unit over. The tractor trailer rolled completely over with the tractor blocking both sides of Hwy 53, and the trailer positioned upside down arched between the road and the drop off area, slanting down about eight feet. Fortunately, Mr. Bell was able to evacuate the vehicle sustaining no injuries. Once out of the unit, Mr. Bell secured the scene making sure there were no hazardous materials compromising the environment. Jackson County Sheriff's Office and Fire Department were dispatched to the scene of the accident. GA DOT also was present to close Highway 53 off and to verify the hazardous cargo was not compromising the environment. GA DOT officer MCO Fortson conducted a DOT inspection on the vehicle following the FMCSA-inspection Platform (Driver/Vehicle Examination Report). Seymour's Towing and Recovery responded to the emergency for remediation and recovery. Team Logistics Emergency Team brought another tanker truck to transfer products. After conducting a safety briefing, a plan was put into place. The Jackson County Fire Department evacuated the three residents near the accident location for two hours during the transfer of product for safety, then set up a foam and water deployment location. Seymour's grounded and bonded the tanker for transfer, then secured the rolled unit with two wreckers.

item.title: Report I-2024040028
item.description:
Report I-2024040028

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 17:45hrs 3/12/2024, Southeastern Freight Lines employee attempted to load the Outbound shipment onto trailer 289184F located in dock door 35. While loading a protruding piece of wood punctured the 250 gallon tote of UN2922 product. This caused approximately 50 gallons of the product to spill in the Southeastern trailer & on the dock. The tote was maneuvered on its side immediately in efforts to stop the spillage. Containment boom, absorbent pad, & floor dry were used in additional efforts to contain the spill. None of the chemical was near or entered any type of drain system. Southeastern Freight Lines Safety was notified approximately at 17:50hrs. Hazmat 1 was notified approximately at 18:01 hrs. LA State Police & E3/OMI Environmental arrived approximately between 19:30 -20:00hrs. After accessing the situation at hand, E3/OMI Environmental proceeded to pump the waste chemical from the damaged tote into a new tote. They also cleaned & decontaminated the affected area. All clean up efforts concluded approximately at 02:00hrs. E3/OMI will coordinate the pick up of the following: 1-empty 250 gallon tote, 1-300 gallon tote, 4-55 gallon drums with clean up, 1-bag of contaminated pallets & packaging materials, & 1 bag w/ contaminated wooden crate.

item.title: Report I-2024020083
item.description:
Report I-2024020083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: CORDOVA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOO LINE RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 2/6/2024 a SOO Line Railroad (DBA CPKC) Hazardous Materials Officer, Anthony Houdyshell, became aware that FRA Inspector Daniel Perkins had performed a hazmat inspection at the CPKC CORDOVA SPUR TRACK, in CORDOVA, IL. During the Inspection Mr. Perkins cited ECUX 461228 because it was leaking OCTYL ALCOHOL from the bottom outlet valve (BOV) threads past the BOV cap. Estimated release was less than 0.5 gallon. A railroad qualified response contractor was mobilized to investigate and mitigate the leak. Upon arrival, responders found ECUX 46 1228 with a BOV not secured tool tight, and the presence of product weeping around the threads of the BOV cap. The BOV was in the fully closed position, but responders observed that the four-inch bottom outlet ball valve had a small amount of product on the 8-L side of the ball. 1-2 drops fell every 2-3 minutes. Additionally, the four inch bottom outlet flange gasket was observed to be out of round and slightly warped, although the release was not related to the warped gasket. The BOV cap was tightened tool tight with PTFE tape to stop the weeping. The response contractor placed an out of service tag on the BOV, and applied HOMESHOP stickers to both sides of the tank car. The contractor climbed ECUX 461228 and observed the manway with a single loose manway swing bolt. The manway cover seal was cut, all swing bolts loosened, and the manway opened. The manway gasket was verified in good condition. The manway was then closed, and the manway swing bolts were secured to tool tight. Responders returned to Cordova, IL on the following day and verified that ECUX 461228 was not leaking prior to the car being switched into the 3M facility. This move (400 ft) was made under the emergency provisions of 174.5, with a verbal notification made by Houdyshell to FRA. The car was subsequently unloaded by 3M and then an OTMA was obtained to move the car to home shop by ExxonMobil. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a "bulk" shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

  • Description: It was reported a spill occurred on the dock in Greencastle, PA. The spill consists of approximately 2 gallons combined from 2 separate products that were shipped in the same boxes, the products being Axalta Plastic Primer Surfacer and 2K Urethane Primer. The freight arrived at the terminal already damaged and spilling prior to arrival, likely due to improper loading by the previous terminal. A total of 4-1 gallon metal cans of product were disposed of in 2-20 gallon poly drums, and the spill was cleaned with Oil Dri. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024041005
item.description:
Report X-2024041005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/17/2024 at approximately 2030, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 768735 at the ramp facility in Atlanta, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of two plastic jerricans, packaged inside of a fiberboard box, then overpacked in a larger fiberboard box. One of the jerricans appeared to spill due to a damaged closure. Further inspection revealed that the shipment was not properly declared as a dangerous goods shipment. The inner fiberboard was UN-rated and marked with hazard class 3 label, however, the outer packaging had no such marking or labeling, nor did the shipment have the proper documentation. An online safety data sheet classified the commodity as a combustible liquid via highway transport; however, the flash point would classify it as a fully regulated flammable liquid air IATA. The shipment is being held, pending further investigation by the FAA.

item.description:
Report X-2024041134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY A LOADER ON THE PD 11. THE LOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE AND USING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAPS ON TWO OF THE INNER PLASTIC CONTAINERS WERE LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND TWO OUNCES OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLE WALLED FIBERBOARD BOX

  • Description: RESPONDER FOUND A DAMAGED PACKAGE IN DMP AREA. PACKAGE SPECS: 24X16X24, ECT 32 LBS/IN. PACKAGE HAS NO MARKING OR LABEL TO IDENTIFY AS HAZARDOUS. INSIDE WERE (ACCORDING TO PACKING SLIP) 110 SODASTREAM CYLINDERS, THESE CYLINDERS ARE ONLY TO BE TRANSPORTED IN A SPECIFICALLY DESIGNED CONTAINER WITH DOT-SP. SHIPPING LABEL WAS CUT FROM ONE OF THE SODASTREAM BOX USED FOR RETURNING EMPLY CYLINDERS AND ATTACHED ON BOX. SODASTREAM CYLINDERS/CONTAINER WERE COLLECTED AND PREPARED FOR UNDELARED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS REPORT.

item.title: Report E-2024040424
item.description:
Report E-2024040424

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR TRANSPORTATION LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver stopped at a truck stop in Knoxville, TN on 4/10/2024 around 1140. Upon exiting the truck, the driver noticed there was material leaking from the front of the trailer, onto the front, right tractor tire. The driver called Superior's Regulatory Department. Superior's Regulatory Department called a spill contractor. The spill response contractor arrived and began cleanup efforts. The spill contractor removed most of the drums from the trailer, found the leaking drum (55 gallon steel drum), and then overpacked the leaking drum. Once the leaking drum was overpacked, they cleaned the inside of the trailer. Once the trailer was clean, they reloaded all of the drums back into the trailer. the total amount of material spilled in the trailer was approximately 79 lbs. The only cost incurred will be from the spill contractor. However, we do not have the final bill back yet from the spill contractor.

  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDERWAS CALLED TO RESPOND TO A LEAKING PACKAGE AT DOOR 99. SUPERVISOR SAID PACKAGE WAS NOT LEAKING BUT HAD A STRONG SMELL. NO OUTER MARKINGS ON PACKAGE, THE BOX WAS WRAPPED IN BLACK PLASTIC. TOOK PACKAGE BACK TO PSC CAGE, DISCOVERED IT WAS LEAKING AND INNER BOX HAD A LIMITED QUANTITY DESIGNATION ON IT. METAL CANS INSIDE BOX WERE DENTED AND CRUSHED. RESPONDER DISCOVERED UNDECLARED WHEN SDS FOR THE SHIPMENT SHOWS IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN SHIPPED AS A HAZARD CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID AS PER DOT CLASSIFICATION. SOLIDIFIED ALL CONTENTS AND DISPOSED OF VIA DMP PROGRAM.

item.title: Report E-2024040040
item.description:
Report E-2024040040

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: MADISONVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 3/30/2024, at 11:12 hours, personnel in the CSXT Atkinson Yard in Madisonville, KY, reported GATX93341, a loaded tank car of Fluorosilicic Acid leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Simplot Phosphates, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #20240330-00051). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found that the release was due to a faulty pressure relief device; the vent assembly was found with no rupture disc, surge protection sleeve, or rupture disc retaining ring. Additionally, the threads utilized for installing a rupture disc retention ring into the assembly base were broken. MEI personnel removed the faulty pressure relief device and replaced with an in-kind assembly to temporarly secure the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Anthony Guillen 208-780-0794). The car was held out of transportation at Madisonville, KY pending additional repair by a certified car shop.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: SALINA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAE experienced a UN2920 Bulk Strip 881 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted trailer floor was cleaned and neutralized with Fabuloso and Oil Dri. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040529
item.description:
Report E-2024040529

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Lone Star Hazmat Response was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) quart of material was released due improper loading of the freight that resulted in one (1) 15-gallon plastic jug to overturn and leak. Lone Star Hazmat Response personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum along with impacted cardboard and plastic wrap. The 15-gallon plastic jug was inspected, and no damage was observed. The jugs bung was tightened and shipped onto the consignee. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: During sort operations at the CLER facility a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained four one gallon cans and two one quart cans packaged inside of a plastic bag. One of the quart cans was dented causing the lid to open and spill the contents. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for a new declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024040937
item.description:
Report X-2024040937

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO A TRIGGER TERM OF FLAMMABLE ON THE OUTER BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE OLYMPUS 600-BAT-L 52 WH LI-ION BATTERY INSIDE THE BOX. THE BATTERY IS PACKAGED WITH FOUR FLAMMABLE AEROSOL PRODUCTS CLASSIFIED AS UN1950, AEROSOLS FLAMMABLE, 2.1. TWO OF THE FLAMMABLE PRODUCTS ARE MAGNAFLUX SPOTCHECK SKL-SP2. TWO ARE MAGNAFLUX SPOTCHECK SKD-S2. ADDITIONALLY, THERE ARE FIFTEEN X TWELVE OUNCE BOTTLES OF ULTRASONIC COUPLANT THAT APPEAR NOT TO BE REGULATED IN TRANSPORTATION. THE CAPS ON A FEW OF THESE BOTTLES WERE LOOSE AND APPEAR TO HAVE LEAKED WITHIN THE BOX VISIBLE BY RESIDUE ON THE OUTER BOTTLES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024041131
item.description:
Report X-2024041131

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: BELLEVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THERE WERE SIMULTANEOUS CALLS FOR DMP 1) WET SPOT ON THE MIDDLE BELT 2) LEAKING HAZMAT FRONT BELT NEAR 608. DESIGNATED RESPONDER IN BOOTS, APRON, GOGGLES, GLOVES WITH LINERS, SLEEVES, AND WITH A 2023 DECISION TREE AND CART, TESTED THE PH OF THE INITIAL SPOT AND CONTAINED THE SPOT ON THE MIDDLE BELT. HE ASKED SUPERVISOR TO LEAVE THE BELT SECURE AND LEAVE ALL PACKAGES ON THE BELT. AT THIS TIME A SECOND RESPONDER DONNED BOOTS, APRON, GOGGLES, GLOVES WITH LINERS, SLEEVES, AND ALSO CART AND DECISION TREE REPORTED TO THE INTIAL SPOT ON THE MIDDLE BELT. BOTH RESPONDERS WORKED FROM EACH END NEUTRALIZING ANY SPOTS AND SORTING LEAKED ON PACKAGES FROM CLEAN PACKAGES. RESPONDERS ALSO CLEARED AND TREATED BELT AND PACKAGES COMING FROM SORTING PLATFORMS. ALL PACKAGES AND MATERIALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2924 was damaged due to manufacture error and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. The crew overpacked the damaged container in one (1) 55-gallon drum. All impacted debris was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: METAL PAIL WAS INSIDE FEEDER TRUCK IN DOOR 16. THERE WAS PAINT LEAKING FROM THE PAIL AT THE BOTTOM OF THE STACK. IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND FOLLOWED DECISION TREE GUIDELINES. THE LABEL AND SHIPPING PAPERS OFFERED INFORMATION ON LEAKER. PICKED UP PAIL AND RESIDUE WITH CLAY ABSORBENT AND TRANSPORTED IT TO HAZMAT AREA AND TURNED ON THE FAN TO CIRCULATE AIR. RESPONDER CONTINUED WITH DMP PROCESS.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) cups of material was released due to improper loading that resulted in one (1) 50-pound plastic bag becoming damaged. Miller Environmental Group personnel gathered the released material and placed the recovered material and damaged bag into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: There was no leaking of propane from the delivery bobtail. Delivery truck approached a semi w/ trailer turning left from HWY47 onto Matteson road While going North Two Cars were waiting and the driver of delivery truck Two cars were waiting and the driver of delivery truck had the sun in his eyes and was unable to brake quick enough to time. The front passenger side of the BMW car , this pushed the car into the back of a pickup causing it to flip onto top of the vehicle and hitting the BMW. Meanwhile the delivery driver flipped onto the drivers side, sliding to a stop when hitting the semi's trailer that had been turning onto Matteson Rd. Mcminniville Gas owner and service guy then accessed the delivery truck & found no leaks. They then emptied 1200 gallons out of the truck and the tow company pulled the truck upright.

item.title: Report E-2024040477
item.description:
Report E-2024040477

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-19
  • City: S CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCH experienced a UN1760 Gardoclean S 5489 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents and vinegar were then deployed and worked into the impacted area to clean and neutralize the release. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents, pads, and PPE into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024040731
item.description:
Report X-2024040731

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: COUNCIL BLUFFS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17761
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03-21-2024 the CN Dangerous Goods Team was notified by a CN Transportation employee that an FRA Hazmat inspector observed liquid around the Plug of the Liquid valve in the protective housing on Tank Car # PPRX55097 while performing a regulatory compliance check at the CN Council Bluffs Yard in Council Bluffs, IA. A CN response contractor was dispatched to the yard to investigate. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for mitigation. The CN contractor found liquid around the plug of the liquid valve. Plug was tool tight (not able to move by hand) but no teflon tape was observed. The CN emergency response contractor ensured that the valve handle was seated properly. Plug was removed and liquid was observed between the plug and valve seat. Liquid was cleared and the valve seat was observed for 5 mins to check for any continued leaks. Protective housing was then secured using an HMRI security seal.

item.description:
Report E-2024040475

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While offloading a shipment at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Baytown, TX, it was discovered that there were a few pallets with three drums on them loaded into the truck at the shipper's location. As a result one drum was not completely blocked in and toppled over during transit. Material leaked from the bung hole onto the trailer floor. Before picking up the drum to its upright position, the bung was tightened to prevent further leakage.

item.description:
Report E-2024040468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: GLADE SPRING
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 13, 2024, at 2240 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Glade Spring, Virginia regarding the release of approximately 45 gallons of METHYL ETHYL KETONE (UN1193, 3, III) from (4) 55-gallon DM’s. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by multiple pallets breaking creating punctures and was contained to the trailer floor and a 1ft x 1ft area of asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (1) 55-gallon DM, and the 4 damaged drums with remaining product were each placed in 85-gallon DM overpacks and was taken offsite by contractors.

item.description:
Report E-2024040470

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 10, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was cracked and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized an 85-gallon open top drum to overpack and contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted loading dock floor and worked them in with hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to collect any residual product from the impacted areas. All UN1263 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 15-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 10, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of UN3149 was damaged and released approximately 0.063 gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. A neutralizing agent was deployed to the impacted surfaces and absorbent pads/cleaners were used to remove any residual product from the impacted surfaces. The one (1) damaged 1-gallon pail was patched and overpacked into one (1) 35-gallon vented drum. All UN3149-impacted materials were collected and containerized into two (2) additional 35-gallon vented drums for disposal purposes.

  • Description: On April 9, 2024, one (1) 350-gallon tote of acetone had a faulty valve and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Crews transferred the remaining contents of the damaged stainless steel tote into six (6) 55-gallon steel drums and labeled not to ship. The impacted surfaces were remediated with absorbents and all waste collected and contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste and the empty tote were staged onsite at the terminal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a one gallon release of regulated UN1824 "Instant Power Main Line Cleaner" arrived damaged at Terminal NOF. The caller stated that a case containing four one-gallon plastic jugs were punctured by a forklift at the loading terminal. The safety data sheet was reviewed with the caller, and advised that a contractor would be needed to complete the cleanup. Hulls arrived onsire, the team will downstack the pallet and collect the impacted jugs and they will neutralize the impacted area with vinegar. All waste will be placed into poly drums. Only one 55-gallon DF of spent absorbent and debris was generated for this spill. All waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024040730
item.description:
Report X-2024040730

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-23
  • City: COUNCIL BLUFFS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1688
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03-21-2024 the CN Dangerous Goods Team was notified by a CN Transportation employee that an FRA Hazmat inspector observed liquid pooling around the Blind Flange of the Liquid line in the protective housing on Tank Car #UTLX 110020 while performing a regulatory compliance check at the CN Council Bluffs Yard in Council Bluffs, IA. A CN response contractor was dispatched to the yard to investigate. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for mitigation. The CN contractor found that four (4) bolts on the Liquid Line blind flange were less than tool tight. The CN emergency response tightened the bolts, stopping the leak. The contractor observed the flange after tightening for 5 mins to ensure there was no further leakage from the flange. Protective housing was then secured using a HMRI security seal.

item.title: Report I-2024040057
item.description:
Report I-2024040057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: College Park
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BOGG EXPRESS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. Upon opening trailer to offload, a leak was discovered at nose of trailer. Area was isolated and ERLLC was dispatched to assess. Upon inspection of the trailer, ERLLC detected two(2) damaged 5-gallon pails. Apparently, the pails had fallen in transit due to improper blocking. Approximately 1 gallon of free product had released to the trailer floor. Less than 1 ounce had dripped to asphalt beneath trailer. ERLLC proceeded to clean trailer floor, overpacked the damaged pails into one 55-gallon overpack drum, and cleaned the affected asphalt. ERLLC returned the following day, offloaded shipment to gain access to entire trailer floor, and proceeded to clean trailer floor and wipe floor of all residual. Product was contained to immediate area, there was no threat or impact to state waters, and no further action was required.
